briefdescription.para: The current direction (horizontal or vertical) of scroll.
Is scroll animation currently active.
Current step/tick in scroll animation.
Initial X or Y for calculated values in scroll animation.
How much should the finger be adjusted horizontally.
and how much vertically
true if the pressed drawable has received cancel event
Is the container currently pressed (maybe show scrollbars)
Is the container scrolling (i.e. has overcome the initial larger drag that is required to initiate a scroll).
The drawable child of this container which should receive drag events. Note that only drag events in directions which cannot be scrolled by this ScrollableContainer will be forwarded to children.
The maximum velocity of a scroll (due to a swipe)
The drawable child of this container which received the last ClickEvent::PRESSED notification. When scrolling, send this drawable a CANCEL event if the new x/y coords no longer matches this drawable.
The x coordinate where the last ClickEvent::PRESSED was received.
The y coordinate where the last ClickEvent::PRESSED was received.
Is the container scrollable in the horizontal direction.
Is the container scrollable in the vertical direction.
The scrollbar is semitransparent.
The color of the scrollbar.
The amount of padding. The scrollbar will have a bit of space to the borders of the container.
Are scrollbars always visible.
Are scrollbars visible.
The width of the scrollbar.
Number of ticks the scroll animation should use.
The scrolled horizontal distance.
The scrolled vertical distance.
The threshold which the first drag event received must exceed before scrolling. Default is 5.
Target X or Y value for scroll animation.
The horizontal scrollbar drawable.
The vertical scrollbar drawable.
The scrollbar line.
The (default) maximum velocity of a scroll due to a swipe.
The minimum velocity of a scroll due to a swipe.
Adds a Drawable instance as child to this Container.

detaileddescription.para: The Drawable added will be placed as the element to be drawn last, and thus appear on top of all previously added drawables in the Container.

parameterdescription.para: The Drawable to add.

simplesect.para: Never add a drawable more than once!

briefdescription.para: Used to signal that the size or position of one or more children have changed.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be called on parent nodes to signal that the size of one or more of its children have changed.

briefdescription.para: Enables horizontal scrolling.

detaileddescription.para: By default, scrolling in either direction is enabled, provided that the content is larger than the size of the ScrollableContainer. This function can be used to explicitly (dis)allow horizontal scrolling, even if the content is larger than the container.

parameterdescription.para: If true (default), horizontal scrolling is enabled. If false, horizontal scrolling is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Enables vertical scrolling.

detaileddescription.para: By default, scrolling in either direction is enabled, provided that the content is larger than the size of the ScrollableContainer. This function can be used to explicitly (dis)allow vertical scrolling, even if the content is larger than the container.

parameterdescription.para: If true (default), vertical scrolling is enabled. If false, vertical scrolling is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Gets the area that contains all children added to the ScrollableContainer.

detaileddescription.para: The scrollbars are not considered in this operation.

briefdescription.para: Gets the last child in the list of children in this Container.

detaileddescription.para: If this Container is touchable (isTouchable()), it will be passed back as the result. Otherwise all visible children are traversed recursively to find the Drawable that intersects with the given coordinate.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of the intersection.
The y coordinate of the intersection.
out parameter in which the result is placed.

briefdescription.para: Gets the distance scrolled for the x-axis.

simplesect.para: the distance scrolled for the x-axis.

briefdescription.para: Gets the distance scrolled for the y-axis.

simplesect.para: the distance scrolled for the y-axis.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for ClickEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the Drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The ClickEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for DragEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The DragEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for GestureEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the Drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The GestureEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Called periodically by the framework if the Drawable instance has subscribed to timer ticks.
Is the ClickableContainer scrollable in either direction? Takes the width of the contained elements into account and also checks to see if horizontal or vertical scrolling is allowed.

parameterdescription.para: True if the container is able to scroll horizontally.
True if the container is able to scroll vertically.

briefdescription.para: Calls moveRelative on all children.

parameterdescription.para: Horizontal displacement.
Vertical displacement.

simplesect.para: Takes care not to move the scrollbars, which are also children.

briefdescription.para: Resets the ScrollableContainer to its original state, before the user started dragging the contents.

detaileddescription.para: This reset the x/y coordinates of children to the position they were in before the first drag event was received.

briefdescription.para: Sets the maximum velocity of a scroll due to a swipe.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to force smooth scrolling by limiting the speed of any swipe gesture.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum velocity of the scroll.

briefdescription.para: Sets the amount of space between the scrollbar and the edge of the ScrollableContainer.

parameterdescription.para: The padding.

briefdescription.para: Sets the alpha value (transparency) of the scrollbars.

parameterdescription.para: The alpha value. 255 being completely solid, 0 being completely invisible.

briefdescription.para: Sets the color of the scrollbars.

parameterdescription.para: The color of the box.

briefdescription.para: Make scrollbars permanently visible regardless of the size and position of the children of the ScrollableContainer.

detaileddescription.para: Normally the scrollbars are hidden and only shown when dragging the contents of the ScrollableContainer (unless prohibited using setScrollbarsVisible()).

briefdescription.para: Sets the visibility of the scrollbars, when the scrollable area is pressed.

detaileddescription.para: By default the scrollbars are hidden, but shown when the contents of the ScrollableContainer is being dragged around. Using setScrollbarsVisible, it is possble to hide the scrollbars when dragging the contents.

parameterdescription.para: If true (default), the scrollbars are visible when scrollable area is pressed. If false, scrollbars are always hidden.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of the scrollbar measured in pixels.

parameterdescription.para: The width of the scrollbar.

briefdescription.para: Change the threshold which the first drag event received must exceed before initiating a scroll.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to avoid touching the screen and moving the finger only a few pixels resulting in the contents being scrolled.

parameterdescription.para: The new threshold value.

simplesect.para: All subsequent scrolls will be processed regardless of threshold value until a ClickEvent::RELEASED is received.

briefdescription.para: Method to actually scroll the container.

detaileddescription.para: Passing negative values will scroll the items in the ScrollableContainer up / left, whereas positive values will scroll items down / right.
If the distance is larger than allowed, the deltas are adjusted down to make sure the contained items stay inside view.

parameterdescription.para: The horizontal amount to scroll.
The vertical amount to scroll.

simplesect.para: did the container actually scroll. The call doScroll(0,0) will always return false.

briefdescription.para: Gets the area where the horizontal scrollbar can move.

parameterdescription.para: The current horizontal scrollbar, supplied for caching reasons.
The current vertical scrollbar, supplied for caching reasons.

briefdescription.para: Gets x coordinate of the scrollbar.
Gets the area where the vertical scrollbar can move.

parameterdescription.para: The current horizontal scrollbar, supplied for caching reasons.
The current vertical scrollbar, supplied for caching reasons.

briefdescription.para: Gets y coordinate of the scrollbar.
Invalidate the scrollbars.
A ScrollableContainer is a container that allows its contents to be scrolled.

detaileddescription.para: It will intercept drag operations and move child nodes accordingly.

A standard Container will simply clip children that are either larger than the container itself, or children that extend beyond the borders of the container or children that are placed outside the borders of the container. A ScrollableContainer behaves much like a Container, except it enables the user to scroll the children and thereby act like a viewport. When the contents of the ScrollableContainer is scrollable, scrollbars can be seen near the edge of the ScrollableContainer.

simplesect.para: The ScrollableContainer will consume all DragEvents in the area covered by the container.
